original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party: (a) commits a material breach of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after receiving written notice of the breach; (b) becomes the subject of a voluntary petition in bankruptcy or any voluntary proceeding relating to insolvency; or (c) ceases to conduct business in the ordinary course.
gold_simplification: Either party can immediately cancel this agreement with written notice if the other party: (1) seriously breaks the agreement and doesn't fix it within 30 days after being notified, (2) files for bankruptcy, or (3) stops doing business normally.
key_facts: Either party can terminate for cause
Three triggers: material breach (with 30-day cure), bankruptcy, business cessation
